articles.name: Youtuber/Twitch Partner Program
articles.body:
Benefits:

  • Custom Cape, Bandana, Shield and Hat on our shop
  • Premium+ Perks
  • Access to all cosmetics on Silent Client
  • Ability to change Twitch/Youtube Icon
  • Private Discord access with our development/administration teams

Requirements

Youtube:
  • Have a passion for Minecraft content
  • Have an active Youtube channel (at least 3 videos in the last month around MC)
  • Have at least 200 Subscribers
  • Have at least 800-1000 Monthly Views on Channel Overall
Twitch:
  • Have a passion for Minecraft content
  • Have an active Twitch channel (at least 5 streams per month around MC)
  • Have at least 50 followers on Twitch
  • Have at least 10 viewers on average during your streams
  • Have at least 20 hours of MC streamed per month for the past three months.

Application

1) IGN:
2) Youtube Channel (if applicable):
3) Twitch Channel (if applicable):
4) Most recent youtube video:

How to Apply

Anyone who is a content creator that meets our requirements listed out can contact creators@silentclient.net.

articles.name: Tester Application
articles.body:
What is a Tester?

The role of a Tester in the team is to find bugs, or issues within the client and report them to the developers. You may find yourself reporting game crashes, mods that do not work as intended or helping other testers check problems within the client.

A typical day for a tester involves the following:

  • Checking the Discord for announcements and/or new features to test
  • Communicating with other testers/developers to fix bugs
  • Reporting bugs
  • Attempting to break the game
  • Playing the game


How to apply

To apply, please simply fill out this form.

Please do not share your personal information (e.g. full real name, address) in your application. If we require any more information other than what was asked in the application, we will make sure to contact you regarding it. If you have not received any response to your application within 30 days of it being sent, it means that you got denied. Please note that only the successful applicants will receive a response to their application.

Do not contact any staff members regarding your application, as it will result in an instant denial.

articles.name: Adding mods to Silent Client or Using it with Forge
articles.body:
Can I add my own mods to Silent Client?

No, you can't do it. Silent Client is a Minecraft client that includes a variety of custom-coded mods, FPS boosting features, custom cosmetics, and many more unique features. All mods and features need to be coded by hand by our developers (except a few which the original developer gave approval to us), which means that you won't be able to add mods on your own.

This also means that you cannot use Silent Client with Forge as the mods were coded for Silent Client and not Forge.

articles.name: Silent Client FAQ
articles.body:
Frequently Asked Questions

In this help article, you will find answers to the most asked questions. If you can't find your answer, please contact our customer support agents by creating a new support ticket: click here.

What is Silent Client?

Silent Client is a Minecraft client with built-in FPS boost, mods and more.
We are actively working to improve the client and add innovations that our players have asked us for.

Does the Silent Client contain any viruses or trojans?

The Silent Client contains no malicious software such as viruses or trojans. We use special software to protect our intellectual property in the launcher. Sometimes, this is flagged by antivirus services as a virus or a trojan due to how the protection software manipulates the machine language code. Please ignore these warnings and add an exception to your antivirus software for the Silent Client if this happens to you.

Where can I report game bugs?

If you have found a game bug and want to report it to get it fixed as soon as possible, please follow the instructions in this help article: click here.

What mods does the Silent Client use?

The Silent Client supports many mods; too many to list here. The Silent Client team is constantly updating them alongside adding new mods. You can find all mods in the game by pressing the RIGHT-SHIFT key.

Can I add my own mods?

No, You cannot add your own mods to the Silent Client. We have explained it in the support article dedicated to this topic: click here.

Where can I find information about the latest Silent Client updates?

You can find them in the following places:
- News (click here)
- Discord (click here)
- Telegram (click here)
- VK (click here)

categories.name: Account Management
categories.description: Registering and Managing the Silent Client Account.

articles.name: Registering for Silent Client
articles.body:
Step one:
To register in Silent Client, you need to go to the registration page. Click here to open the registration page.

Step two:
Fill out the registration form and click "Register".
Attention! In the Minecraft Username field, you need to specify the username that will be used in the game.

Step three:
Congratulations, and welcome to Silent Client! You have successfully registered on Silent Client!

articles.name: Changing your email, password and privacy settings
articles.body:
To change any of your account information, go to the profile edit page: https://store.silentclient.net/edit_account.
We tried to simplify the interface as much as possible so that even a child could figure it out.

articles.name: Reseting your Password
articles.body:
Step one:
Open your web browser and go to https://store.silentclient.net/reset_password

Step two:
Enter your Email address linked to your Silent Client account. If you no longer have access to Email, you need to create a new account. Click here to open the guide.

Step three:
After filling in the email address, click the "Reset" button.

Step four:
Go to your inbox and look for a message from Silent Client. If you don't see messages in your main inbox, check your spam/junk folders.

Step five:
The email will contain the generated password, use it to log into your account.

categories.name: Support Center
categories.description: Payment Support, Technical Support, and Vanilla Minecraft Problems.

articles.name: Adding More Memory (RAM) to your Silent Client
articles.body:
When should I change the amount of allocated memory?

We all love to play Minecraft, especially when using high-resolution resource packs and shaders, but using such resources in Minecraft makes it power-hungry. It consumes a lot of memory (RAM) on your computer. If your game does not have enough memory allocated to it, its frames (FPS) may decrease, and you might start experiencing lag spikes (FPS drops), it may load slowly, and sometimes it might even crash. If you start experiencing any of the mentioned problems, you should consider using the built-in option to change the amount of allocated memory.

How can I add more memory to Minecraft on the Silent Client launcher?

Note: we do not suggest allocating more than half of the available memory. You should keep the allocated memory between 2-4 GB, depending on how much total RAM your computer has.

If you want to change the amount of allocated memory, you need to do the following:
  • Open the Silent Client launcher and click the "Settings" button, as shown in the screenshot below.
  • Find "Allocate RAM (MB)" slider. You can click anywhere on the slider to change the amount of the allocated memory.

articles.name: Game has no sound
articles.body:
Check the in-game sound settings to make sure you haven't muted any sounds.
If you don't know where to find Minecraft sound & music settings, do the following: open Minecraft Options, then click on the "Music & Sounds" button.

Check your computer's volume mixer or any other sound software that you have installed to make sure you haven't muted the Silent Client.
Open the Silent Client launcher, then launch the game, and only then open the volume mixer.

Try reloading resources.
To do that, you need to connect to a server or singleplayer world, then press the ESC key on your keyboard, and then click on the "Reload Resources" button at the bottom left corner.

If the same issue persists, please submit a bug report through the launcher immediately after having this issue.

articles.name: Submitting a Bug Report
articles.body:
How can I submit a bug report?

If you have found a bug, please do the following to report it to us:
  • Click on "Submit Bug Report" at the bottom of the launcher. If you have changed the language in the launcher, it will say something else.
  • It will bring you to this page where you have to fill out some questions so we can know what is wrong.
    Make sure to explain the issue in detail and provide a screenshot or video if possible. A well-written bug report helps our Tech Support team and developers to reproduce and fix the bug. You can use https://workupload.com/ to upload screenshots and videos.
    Please do not remove any logs from your bug report! Our Tech Support and developers need your logs to see the exact cause of the issue! If your bug report is missing logs, restart the launcher, reproduce the problem, and submit a new bug report through the bottom of the launcher, as explained in this article above.
  • Don't forget to click "Submit" when you have finished!
Once you have submitted a bug report, our Tech Support team should review and respond to it within a few hours.

articles.name: Updating Windows and Graphics Driver
articles.body:
Updating Graphics Card via the internet

Your Windows installation and your graphics drivers are probably requiring an update to be able to run the SIlent Client smoothly.

If you know what graphics card you have, feel free to update it on your own; else, go to "Updating Graphics card via Windows" in this article.

  • AMD - https://www.amd.com/en/support
  • Nvidia - https://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx
  • Intel - https://downloadcenter.intel.com/product/80939/Graphics

Updating through Device Manager

If you wish to update your graphics card through your computer, you will need to do so through Device Manager. Do this after downloading the correct driver from the links above.

1) Type "Device Manager" in Start Menu.

2) Go to "Display Adapters" and whichever driver shows up there.

  • You will need to right click and select "Update".

3) Click "Search Automatically for Drivers".

4) Done!

Updating Graphics card via Windows

Users who understand the computer and its working should do this, or else use the basic guide.

Manually Install Driver Updates

  1. Type "Check for Updates" in Start Menu.


  2. The window should look like the following image.


  3. Click on "View Optional Updates".


  4. The following window will pop up.


  5. Select everything that is from NVIDIA/Intel/AMD/Ryzen and click "Download and Install".


  6. You will then be brought back to the "Windows Update" page and it will show you the process of the updates.


  7. Once it is done this notification will pop up; and then restart your computer.

categories.name: Premium Rank Help
categories.description: Silent Premium and Its Features and Custom Capes.

articles.name: Premium and Premium+ Ranks
articles.body:
The Premium and Premium+ ranks give you access to exclusive features to enhance your Minecraft gaming experience. It is also a great way to support our work and pursue the development of the Silent Client. You can purchase Premium and Premium+ in our store: https://store.silentclient.net/premium

Enabling Beta Mode & Having Early Access to New Features

Both the Premium and the Premium+ rank allow you to have early access to the new features of the Silent Client. You can play on the Beta version by ticking the "Beta" option above the launch button.



Opening Premium settings

To open Premium settings, connect to a single-player world or server, press RSHIFT on your keyboard and go to the Premium tab.





Premium features

You can find a full list of the Premium and Premium+ features on our store. Here is the link to it: https://store.silentclient.net/premium

Premium Nametag Icon



Premium+ Nametag Icon



The Premium and Premium+ icons can be seen by anyone who uses the Silent Client. The icon shows before your name, on the tab list, and the friends' list.
Note: You must enable the Nametags mod to see nametag icons and messages.

Premium+ Nametag Message



The Premium+ custom message lets you add a custom message above your name!
You can add your nametag message by clicking on the text field at the bottom of Premium settings, writing a message, and clicking on the "Save" button.
